item.title: Facebook 关闭了司法部称被用于骚扰 ICE 探员的页面
item.description: 美国司法部周二表示，Meta 公司已经按照要求撤下了其 Facebook 平台上的一个页面，该机构称该页面被用来骚扰芝加哥的 ICE 探员。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday that Meta had complied with its request to take down a page on its Facebook platform that the agency said was being used to harass ICE agents in Chicago.】

item.title: 欧盟反垄断罚款迫在眉睫，谷歌主动调整搜索结果
item.description: 据路透社看到的一份文件显示，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌已提出对其搜索结果进行进一步修改，以避免被欧盟处以反垄断罚款。【原文：Alphabet's Google has offered to make further changes to its search results in its latest attempt to avoid a European Union antitrust fine, according to a document seen by Reuters.】

item.title: VIEW 美联储鲍威尔称经济基础更加稳固，QT 结束在望
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，尽管美国经济整体 "可能比预期更稳健"，但美国劳动力市场在9月份仍深陷低招聘、低雇用的低迷状态。【原文：The U.S. labor market remained mired in its low-hiring, low-firing doldrums through September, though the economy overall "may be on a somewhat firmer trajectory than expected," Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长维勒鲁瓦表示，世界金融稳定需要美国的参与
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）周二表示，保护主义已经证明会让美国消费者付出高昂的代价，华盛顿应该与其盟友合作，共同解决威胁金融稳定的全球问题。【原文：Protectionism is already proving costly for the U.S. consumer and Washington should instead engage with its allies to tackle global issues that threaten financial stability, French central bank governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 加密货币投资者 "比特币耶稣 "就解决美国税务指控达成协议
item.description: 美国司法部周二表示，一名被称为 "比特币耶稣 "的比特币早期投资者已同意支付高达 4990 万美元，以解决美国对他逃避缴纳数千万美元税款的指控。【原文：An early investor in bitcoins dubbed the "Bitcoin Jesus" has agreed to pay up to $49.9 million to resolve U.S. charges that he evaded paying tens of millions of dollars in taxes, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Humana 输掉了对 2025 年医疗保险优势评级的挑战
item.description: 周二，美国一名法官驳回了 Humana 质疑美国医疗保险与医疗补助服务中心对其医疗保险优势项目 2025 年评级的请求，这可能使该公司从政府那里获得数百万美元的奖金。【原文：A U.S. judge on Tuesday rejected Humana's bid to challenge the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services' 2025 ratings for its Medicare Advantage programs, which could cost the company millions in bonus payments from the government.】

item.title: 中国市场改善，LVMH 销售额恢复增长
item.description: 本周二，法国路威酩轩集团（LVMH）公布第三季度销售额增长 1%，主要得益于中国市场需求的增长，而奢侈品行业正面临着长期的低迷。【原文：France's LVMH reported a 1% rise in third quarter sales on Tuesday, helped by improved demand in China, as the luxury goods industry grapples with a prolonged slump.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称资产负债表缩减可能接近尾声
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，央行长期以来缩减持仓规模的努力（即广为人知的量化紧缩政策）可能即将结束。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday the end of the central bank’s long-running effort to shrink the size of its holdings, widely known as quantitative tightening, or QT, may be coming into view.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称经济基础更加稳固，但低招聘、低解雇趋势仍在继续
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二表示，尽管经济整体 "可能比预期更稳健"，但美国劳动力市场在9月份仍处于低招聘、低雇用的低迷状态，同时他还指出，在平衡就业市场疲软与通胀率仍远高于2%目标之间的关系时，决策者将采取 "逐次会议 "的方式来决定是否进一步降息。【原文：The U.S. labor market remained mired in its low-hiring, low-firing doldrums through September, though the economy overall "may be on a somewhat firmer trajectory than expected," Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said on Tuesday, noting that policymakers will take a "meeting-by-meeting" approach to any further interest rate cuts as they balance job market weakness with the fact that inflation remains well above their 2% target.】

item.title: 花旗集团使用人工智能每周为开发人员节省 10 万小时
item.description: 花旗集团首席执行官简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）说，公司使用人工智能节省了时间，使软件开发人员每周可腾出 10 万小时的工作时间。【原文：Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser said the company's use of artificial intelligence has saved time and allowed it to free up 100,000 hours of weekly capacity for software developers.】

item.title: LVMH集团第三季度销售额超预期，业绩恢复增长
item.description: 法国路威酩轩集团（LVMH）是全球最大的奢侈品集团，该集团周二公布的第三季度销售额增长了 1%，这主要得益于中国市场需求的增长，而中国奢侈品行业正面临着长期的低迷。【原文：France's LVMH , the world's largest luxury goods group, reported a 1% rise in third-quarter sales on Tuesday, helped by improved demand in China as the industry grapples with a prolonged slump.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，在推动人工智能发展的同时，高盛也在考虑裁员和放缓招聘速度
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，高盛已经通知员工，由于这家华尔街巨头希望利用人工智能提高生产率，因此在今年年底前可能会裁员并放缓招聘速度。【原文：Goldman Sachs has informed employees of potential job cuts and a hiring slowdown through the end of the year, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters, as the Wall Street giant aims to use artificial intelligence to enhance productivity.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，Enagas 正在洽谈收购法国天然气运输网络运营商 Terega 的 GIC 股份
item.description: 据两位熟悉情况的人士透露，西班牙天然气电网运营商 Enagas 正在洽谈收购新加坡主权财富基金 GIC 持有的法国第二大天然气输送运营商 Terega 32% 的股份。【原文：Spanish gas grid operator Enagas is in talks to acquire Singaporean sovereign wealth fund GIC's 32% stake in Terega, France's second-largest gas transmission operator, according to two people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 加拿大 BCE 预计到 2028 年将节省 15 亿加元成本
item.description: BCE 将其 2028 年的成本节约目标提高了 50%，达到 15 亿加元（10.7 亿美元），因为这家电信和媒体公司正在简化运营，并寄希望于北美扩张来推动其增长。【原文：BCE raised its 2028 cost-saving target by 50% to C$1.5 billion ($1.07 billion) as the telecom and media company simplifies operations and bets on its North America expansion to power its growth.】

item.title: 意大利游说团体称中国稀土限制令欧洲汽车业面临风险
item.description: 意大利汽车零部件制造商游说团体 ANFIA 的负责人周二表示，由于稀土金属的储量较低，预计中国对稀土金属出口的新限制措施可能会对欧洲汽车工业产生重大影响。【原文：Expected new Chinese curbs on rare earth metal exports could have a significant impact on the European auto industry, the head of Italian auto part maker lobby ANFIA said on Tuesday, as reserves of those materials are low.】

item.title: 美国推进 200 亿美元救助计划，特朗普将会见阿根廷总统米磊
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将于周二在白宫接待阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱，就在几天前，美国同意向这个南美国家提供一条重要的金融生命线。【原文：President Donald Trump will host Argentina's president, Javier Milei, at the White House on Tuesday, just days after the U.S. agreed to provide a major financial lifeline to the South American nation.】

item.title: 波音公司九月份交付 55 架喷气式飞机，但落后于空中客车公司
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，9月份交付了55架喷气式飞机，高于去年同期的33架，当时西北部工厂的33000名工人罢工，导致生产缩减。【原文：Boeing delivered 55 jets in September, up from 33 a year earlier when a strike by 33,000 factory workers in the Northwest curtailed production, the planemaker said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 波音公司获得欧盟反垄断许可，同意以 47 亿美元收购 Spirit Aerosystems 公司
item.description: 波音公司在同意出售 Spirit 的部分业务以解决竞争问题后，于周二获得了欧盟的反垄断批准，以 47 亿美元收购 Spirit。【原文：Boeing secured EU antitrust approval on Tuesday for its $4.7 billion acquisition of Spirit after agreeing to sell some Spirit businesses to address competition concerns.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼预计今年将再降息两次
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周二表示，她仍然预计美国央行将在 2025 年的最后两次政策会议上降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman on Tuesday said she continues to anticipate that the U.S. central bank will deliver interest rate cuts at its final two policy meetings of 2025.】

item.title: 欧盟向美国施压要求降低金属含量关税
item.description: 欧盟贸易委员马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）周二表示，欧盟委员会正在向美国施压，要求美国取消对钢铁产品征收的关税，因为布鲁塞尔正努力推进欧盟与美国关税协议中尚未生效的部分内容。【原文：The European Commission is pressing the United States to remove tariffs on products made from steel as Brussels seeks to advance parts of the EU-U.S. tariff deal that have yet to enter force, EU Trade Commissioner Maros Sefcovic said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 沃尔玛与 OpenAI 合作推出 ChatGPT 购物功能
item.description: 沃尔玛周二表示，它将与 OpenAI 合作，使顾客和山姆会员店会员能够使用人工智能聊天机器人的即时结账功能，直接在 ChatGPT 上购物。【原文：Walmart said on Tuesday it was partnering with OpenAI to enable customers and Sam's Club members to shop directly within ChatGPT, using the AI chatbot's Instant Checkout feature.】

item.title: 贝莱德撇开 First Brands 和 Tricolor 破产后更广泛的信贷传染担忧
item.description: 资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）周二淡化了汽车零部件供应商First Brands和贷款公司Tricolor Holdings破产后信贷市场压力扩大的担忧，称借款人的整体信贷质量 "普遍强劲"。【原文：Asset manager BlackRock on Tuesday played down concerns of broader credit market stress after the bankruptcies of auto parts supplier First Brands and lender Tricolor Holdings, saying the overall credit quality of borrowers was "generally strong."】

item.title: 英国监管机构为 BlueCrest 基金投资者争取到 1.01 亿美元赔偿金
item.description: 英国金融行为监管局（Financial Conduct Authority）周二为 BlueCrest Capital Management 子管理的一家基金的投资者争取到了 1.01 亿美元的赔偿，并对该投资公司进行了公开谴责。【原文：Britain's Financial Conduct Authority on Tuesday secured a $101 million redress for investors in a fund sub-managed by BlueCrest Capital Management, and imposed a public censure on the investment firm.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）警告：对央行信任度的下降可能会刺激通胀预期
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周二表示，向各国央行施加降息压力 "总是适得其反"，并警告说，对货币当局的信任度下降可能会抑制通胀预期。【原文：The International Monetary Fund on Tuesday said putting pressure on central banks to lower interest rates "always backfires," warning that erosion of trust in monetary authorities could de-anchor inflation expectations.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织警告全球市场 "无序 "调整的几率上升
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周二表示，全球市场对贸易战、地缘政治紧张局势和巨额政府赤字等风险过于放松，再加上资产价格已经过高，增加了市场 "无序 "调整的可能性。【原文：Global markets are getting too comfortable with risks like trade wars, geopolitical tensions and yawning government deficits, which, combined with already overpriced assets, increase the chance of a "disorderly" market correction, the International Monetary Fund said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 巴西巴西航空工业公司将向 TrueNoord 出售 20 架商用喷气机
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）周二表示，已完成向租赁和管理公司 TrueNoord 出售 20 架 E195-E2 商用飞机的交易，交易价值 18 亿美元。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer closed a deal to sell 20 of its E195-E2 commercial unit to leasing and management firm TrueNoord, in a deal valued at $1.8 billion, the companies said Tuesday.】

item.title: 巴西 BTG Pactual 提议与 Pan 银行合并
item.description: 巴西投资银行 BTG Pactual 周一晚些时候宣布了一项具有约束力的建议，即收购 Pan 银行的股份，为小股东提供大幅溢价，使 Pan 银行成为其间接全资子公司。【原文：Brazilian investment bank BTG Pactual announced late on Monday a binding proposal to incorporate shares of Banco Pan , offering a significant premium to minority shareholders in a move that would make Pan its indirect wholly-owned subsidiary.】

item.title: 印度阿达尼公司看中陷入困境的房地产商撒哈拉公司的数十项资产，以建立土地储备
item.description: 印度亿万富翁高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）的房地产部门正在寻求法院批准，从一家陷入困境的房地产集团手中收购包括酒店和购物中心在内的 87 处房产，此举可能会促进该企业集团规模相对较小的业务发展。【原文：Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's property arm is seeking court approval to acquire 87 properties including hotels and malls from a distressed real estate group, a move that could bolster the conglomerate's relatively small business.】

item.title: 独家报道日本半导体公司瑞萨探索以 20 亿美元出售计时部门
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，瑞萨电子公司（Renesas Electronics Corp. ）正在探讨出售其定时部门，交易价值可能接近 20 亿美元。【原文：Renesas Electronics Corp. is exploring a sale of its timing division in a deal that could value the business at close to $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国最高法院驳回对联邦保护科技平台的质疑
item.description: 美国最高法院拒绝重新评估科技公司对其平台上托管的内容所拥有的广泛法律豁免权，周二驳回了一名男性原告对 Grindr 提起的诉讼的上诉，这名原告在 15 岁时曾被通过同性恋约会应用程序匹配到的成年男子强奸。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court declined a chance to reassess the broad legal immunity tech companies have over content hosted on their platforms, turning away on Tuesday an appeal in a lawsuit against Grindr by a male plaintiff who was raped at age 15 by adult men matched to him via the gay dating app.】
